thread.title: Police SUV collides with building in Little Village - Chicago Tribune
thread.title_full: Police SUV collides with building in Little Village - Chicago Tribune

author: Megan Crepeau
title: Police SUV collides with building in Little Village - Chicago Tribune
text:
Police SUV collides with building in Little Village Police SUV into building Megan Crepeau / Chicago Tribune 
A Chicago police SUV crashed into a building in the 3500 block of West 26th Street about 9:25 p.m. on Friday, Feb. 17, 2017. 
A Chicago police SUV crashed into a building in the 3500 block of West 26th Street about 9:25 p.m. on Friday, Feb. 17, 2017. (Megan Crepeau / Chicago Tribune) Megan Crepeau car crashed into a vacant storefront in Little Village late Friday, leaving one person with minor injuries, authorities said.
Someone veered in front of an unmarked police SUV as it drove in the 3500 block of West 26th Street about 9:25 p.m., police said, causing the driver of the SUV to crash into the building at the corner of 26th Street and Drake Avenue. 
Police said no injuries were reported, but Chicago Fire Department officials said one person was taken in good-to-fair condition to Saint Anthony Hospital. That person is not a police officer, the fire department said. 
The storefront, which used to house a pharmacy, has been vacant for years, neighbors said. The police SUV crashed into the building near the front door, but no major structural damage was apparent. 
A silver car remained on the scene near the police SUV. The silver carâ€™s front bumper had been sheared off and was resting in the intersection between the two vehicles. 
One person is in custody, police said.
